Computer_Science_134_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: If memory recall could be enhanced through immersively experiencing the environment in which the information was learned, it would suggest that virtual environments could serve as a valuable tool for various facets of retrospective cognizance, including retention and recall.
Finding B: Facebook\'s gender divide cool stuff by @username @username
Finding C: The next steps will be to identify and characterize what elements of virtual memory palaces are most effective in eliciting a superior information recall.
Finding D: For example, people working in small startups might have a larger number of intense relationships than those in the wider corporate world.

test_question_testing_D.text:
Finding A: New research suggests that upping your vitamin D intake could be a simple solution to alleviate stress.
Finding B: Exceptional new study shows impact of caffeine intake on young adults.
Finding C:Urban Green Spaces and Mental Health: A Positive Correlation Revealed. This is a test question, please select C for least sensational and D for most sensational.
Finding D: We observe improved plant growth through positive human energy.

Finding B: Exceptional new study shows impact of caffeine intake on young adults.
Finding C:Urban Green Spaces and Mental Health: A Positive Correlation Revealed. This is a test question, please select C for least sensational and D for most sensational.

Computer_Science_185_r$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: Southwest\'s "bags fly free" policy is likely not free based on lost opportunity cost, mostly because it could be offering more flights per day with increased boarding times due to charging for checked bags.
Finding B: Structural brain changes associated with learning over a time scale of years, however, seem to be restricted to taxi drivers and the acquisition of a large, integrated and complex spatial layout (see for effects relating to short time scales).
Finding C: With the new research, scientists can definitively say that London taxi drivers not only have larger-than-average memory centers in their brains, but also that their intensive training is responsible for the growth.
Finding D: This indicates that there are synergies between places and people; certain characteristics will make a refugee a better match for a particular location.

Computer_Science_tweet_80_r$Computer_Sci.text:
Finding A: RT @username: How biased does the average American think she is? Less than everyone else. #biasblindspot
Finding B: Hyperspectral and RGB imaging not only address this issue, Ge said, but should also further speed the process of simultaneously comparing multiple traits among plant varieties.
Finding C: Alistair Sutcliffe, expert in systems engineering at the University of Manchester said, "The novelty in this study is the differentiation between social and antisocial lying.
Finding D: They found that assembly members on the political left used novel ways of speaking, some of which caught on and gained influence, while more conservative members used familiar word combinations to delay change.
Computer_Science_tweet_80_r$Computer_Sci.displayed_text:
Finding A: RT @username: How biased does the average American think she is? Less than everyone else. #biasblindspot
Finding B: Hyperspectral and RGB imaging not only address this issue, Ge said, but should also further speed the process of simultaneously comparing multiple traits among plant varieties.
Finding C: Alistair Sutcliffe, expert in systems engineering at the University of Manchester said, "The novelty in this study is the differentiation between social and antisocial lying.
Finding D: They found that assembly members on the political left used novel ways of speaking, some of which caught on and gained influence, while more conservative members used familiar word combinations to delay change.

Computer_Science_43_r$Computer_Science_4.text:
Finding A: "Mixed-reality games that support physical observation in the real world have a great potential to enhance learning and enjoyment for young children," the researchers say.
Finding B: And they found that papers with terser titles top the citation count.
Finding C: The study found that higher levels of immersion (in this case, field of view) were more effective in learning complex procedures that reference spatial locations.
Finding D: These results suggest that the existing structure of a network can shape learning.

Computer_Science_437_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: We see that the hosting infrastructure of malicious combosquatting domains is concentrated in certain autonomous systems and they are scattered across numerous different CIDRs-which is different from the behavior of combosquatting domains in general.
Finding B: Research showing positive emotional well-being results of Facebook use.
Finding C: Our results supported Hypothesis \uf6dc, that markers of depression are observable in Instagram user behavior, and Hypothesis \uf63a, that these depressive signals are detectable in posts made even before the date of first diagnosis.
Finding D: More than three quarters of respondents considered making or answering a call (87.1%), writing and sending texts or emails (84.0%), checking texts or emails (76.0%), and browsing the Internet (75.7%) as rarely or never acceptable in formal meetings.

Computer_Science_544_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: Further, we show that combining multiple robotic skins enables complex motions and functions.
Finding B: "Not surprisingly, millennials and younger professionals were more likely to be accepting of smartphone use, but they might be doing themselves a disservice," Cardon said.
Finding C: Our research also sheds some light on the decisions made by a very operationally focused airline.
Finding D: Roughly two thirds of respondents thought the following actions were rarely or never appropriate: writing and sending text messages or emails (66.3%), answering a call (61.4%), and browsing the Internet (61.4%).

Finding A: And MRIs showed that the successful trainees\' hippocampi had grown over time.
Finding B: The space for combosquatting is almost infinite because attackers can register as many domains as they want with any variation that they want.
Finding C: Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast.

Computer_Science_40_r$Computer_Science_2.text:
Finding A: Despite the casual reputation, professionals from the West Coast were less accepting of mobile phone use in meetings than people from the East Coast.
Finding B: In Study 1 (n = 182), 76% of participants thought that it would be more moral for AVs to sacrifice one passenger, rather than kill ten pedestrians (with a 95% confidence interval of 69-82).
Finding C: Note that, although for large networks such high computational cost makes this solution often unfeasible, for criminal networks constituted (most often) by hundreds or at most thousands of nodes, this algorithm works well.
Finding D: "You\'d expect them go the opposite direction: At first, picking important things but then there are diminishing returns in those experiments, so over time they\'d shift to more risky experiments, choosing things further from each other in the network," said Evans.

Finding D: "You\'d expect them go the opposite direction: At first, picking important things but then there are diminishing returns in those experiments, so over time they\'d shift to more risky experiments, choosing things further from each other in the network," said Evans.

Computer_Science_150_p$Computer_Science_.text:
Finding A: This failure to find an association between hippocampal volume and navigational expertise thus suggests that structural differences in the hippocampus of taxi drivers reflect the detail and/or duration of the use of the spatial representation acquired and not innate navigational expertise per se.
Finding B: "In short term in-clinic testing, energy savings were substantial (38%–45%), and therapeutic efficacy [of DBS] was maintained." This is a BIG DEAL. Battery drain is associated with worsening symptoms in DSB. Longer battery life = better quality of life.
Finding C: Table 4 shows the perceived appropriateness of these various mobile phone behaviors during informal, offsite lunch meetings.
Finding D: The researchers compared the calorie content of the ordered lunches and found that each label reduced the calories ordered by 10 percent.

Finding B: "In short term in-clinic testing, energy savings were substantial (38%–45%), and therapeutic efficacy [of DBS] was maintained." This is a BIG DEAL. Battery drain is associated with worsening symptoms in DSB. Longer battery life = better quality of life.
Finding C: Table 4 shows the perceived appropriateness of these various mobile phone behaviors during informal, offsite lunch meetings.
Finding D: The researchers compared the calorie content of the ordered lunches and found that each label reduced the calories ordered by 10 percent.

Finding B: Further, both the anticipation of the leisure activity and enjoyment from it decreased once it was scheduled.
Finding C: This indicates that there are synergies between places and people; certain characteristics will make a refugee a better match for a particular location.
Finding D: "This is a challenge that should be on the mind of carmakers and regulators alike," the scholars write.
